intro: Jurinea cartilaginea, commonly known as the cartilaginous jerusalem flower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its water-storing tissues. Jurinea cartilaginea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is a component of desert ecosystems.
